content.description: A sociologist will conduct a two-sample <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-test for a difference in means to investigate whether there is a significant difference, on average, between the salaries of people with bachelor’s degrees and people with master’s degrees. From a random sample of 32 people with a bachelor’s degree, the average salary was $55,000 with standard deviation $3,500. From a random sample of 28 people with a master’s degree, the average salary was $58,000 with a standard deviation of $4,000.
content.question: With a null hypothesis of no difference in the means, which of the following is the test statistic for the appropriate test to investigate whether there is a difference in population means (master’s degree minus bachelor’s degree) ?

choices.label: <math alttext="t equals the complex fraction with numerator 58,000 minus 55,000, and denominator the square root of the fraction with numerator 4,000, and denominator 28, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator 3,500, and denominator 32, end fraction, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mn>58</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mn>000</mn><mo>−</mo><mrow><mn>55</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mn>000</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>4</mn><mtext>,000</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>28</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn><mtext>,500</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>32</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="t equals the complex fraction with numerator 58,000 minus 55,000, and denominator the square root of the fraction with numerator 4,000 squared, and denominator 28, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator 3,500 squared, and denominator 32, end fraction, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mn>58</mn></mrow><mtext>,000</mtext><mo>−</mo><mrow><mn>55</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mn>000</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mn>000</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>28</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mn>500</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>32</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="t equals the square root of the complex fraction with numerator 58,000 minus 55,000, and denominator the fraction with numerator 4,000 squared, and denominator 28, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator 3,500 squared, and denominator 32, end fraction, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mn>58</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mn>000</mn><mo>−</mo><mrow><mn>55</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mn>000</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mn>000</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>28</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mn>500</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>32</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="t equals the complex fraction with numerator 58,000 minus 55,000, and denominator the square root of the fraction with numerator 4,000 plus 3,500, and denominator 28 plus 32, end fraction, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mn>58</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mn>000</mn><mo>−</mo><mrow><mn>55</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mn>000</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>4</mn><mtext>,000</mtext><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mtext>,500</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>28</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>32</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="t equals the complex fraction 58,000 minus 55,000, and denominator the square root of the fraction with numerator 4,000 squared plus 3,500 squared, and denominator 28 plus 32, end fraction, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mn>58</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mn>000</mn><mo>−</mo><mrow><mn>55</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mn>000</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mn>000</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mn>500</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>28</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>32</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="t equals the complex fraction with numerator 58,000 minus 55,000, and denominator the square root of the fraction with numerator 4,000 squared, and denominator 28, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator 3,500 squared, and denominator 32, end fraction, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mn>58</mn></mrow><mtext>,000</mtext><mo>−</mo><mrow><mn>55</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mn>000</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mn>000</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>28</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mn>500</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>32</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 7.9: Carrying Out a Test for the Difference of Two Population Means

skill.text: Skill 3.E: Calculate a test statistic and find a p-value, provided conditions for inference are met.
